title: How do I adjust the length of the parameters in IDA?
content:
In IDA I can easily change the size of the local variables using Alt+P and then changing the "Local Variables area" field to the desired value.

However, how can I do this with the parameters size? IDA has misanalyzed the function and got the result that it has about 30 kilobytes arguments when it actually just has 30 kilobytes variables.

answers_data.content: You can define function type by pressing y or Y on its name. Function type includes number and types of parameters.

comments.text: This doesn't seem to help, in the stack view of said function, the argument space doesn't disappear.

answers_data.content: Open the stack frame window (Ctrl-K or double-click on a variable), then delete bogus arguments with U.
